item.title: Today I Learned: Setting up system updates with systemd timer
item.description:
How I automated Linux system updates with comprehensive logging and learned why systemd timers beat cron

The Wake-Up Call

Picture this: You’re managing a handful of Linux servers (or even just one VPS), and you know you should be keeping them updated. Security patches are released constantly, but manually SSH-ing into each server, running apt update && apt upgrade, waiting for it to complete, and checking for issues is… tedious.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hi, I’m Kaye Shafiq

I’m a Cybersecurity enthusiast on a mission to transition from network engineering to blue team security operations. Based in Kampala, Uganda, I’m building the technical foundation needed to defend systems and networks against real-world threats.

My Journey

My path into cybersecurity started with networking. After earning my CCNA certification, I gained a solid understanding of how data flows, how networks are structured, and—crucially—where vulnerabilities exist. But I realized that to truly protect systems, I needed to understand them at a deeper level.
